unnormalised: With respect to the recent discourse on property disputes, it's crucial to note that under Indian civil law, specifically the Transfer of Property Act, 1882, adverse possession claims require continuous and uninterrupted possession for a period of 12 yrs. As per the judgment in Civil Appeal No. 2450 of 2018, 'Ram Bhajan vs. State of UP', the onus lies on the claimant to prove their possession was hostile to the true owner. Furthermore, Section 6 of the Specific Relief Act, 1963 allows a dispossessed owner to file a suit within 6 months of dispossession.
